metadata.name: Why? #12
metadata.description:
The direction taken by the artwork Why? was taken when contemplating a canvas filled with what could be viewed as huge stone steps. I added the small stick people - were they climbing up or down? Where were they going? Where did they come from?
I then became interested in how subtle changes of background colour and changes of balloon colour changed the story, or the feeling of the story - ranging from bright hope to despair and futility. 

All p5.js.
The artwork is rendered at window size, use keys '2' and '3' to render larger.

metadata.name: Imperium #432
metadata.description:
Imperium is a study of shapes and colors, and how a very small set of shapes and colors, when given equally simple rules, can create a great variety of patterns that may bring meaning to the viewer.

Press the s key for a quick download at the current resolution, and press the space bar to display the export and information menu.

For more information, read the collection guide:
https://medium.com/@MrMallory/imperium-the-collection-guide-cd9ab7e05aa0

Author:
Mr. Mallory (https://twitter.com/MrMallory_)
Authorship checksum: 106d66c91faaa92f388d9f6f9fc949ae

Licenses:
Art: NFT License - https://www.nftlicense.org/
Code: CC BY-NC 4.0 - https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc/4.0/

metadata.name: Swamp Garden Ecosystem #57
metadata.description:
The generated picture presents an ecosystem of swamp
garden wetlands and tadpoles in the water.

In live view mode:
- Press Key "a" to regenerate with scale x1.5 (2160x2160 px)
- Press Key "z" to regenerate with scale x2 (2880x2880 px)
- Press Key "e" to regenerate with scale x2.5 (3600x3600 px)
- Press Key "r" to regenerate with scale x3 (4320x4320 px)
- Press Key "t" to regenerate with scale x3.5 (5040x5040 px)

Press [p] to save captured image to png


Enjoy :)

---
Created using vanilla javascript
KrouniHatim - Nov22
---
(CC BY-ND 4.0)

metadata.name: [[Resemblant]] #8
metadata.description:
Airdrop for first collector Resemblant
https://www.fxhash.xyz/generative/20848
.
(Collectors have the opportunity to mint as many NFTs as they have)
.
Thank you for supporting us
.
Made by p5js
"This token is a layered PNG"

metadata.name: Coronado #116
metadata.description:
This series is about the beauty and charm of imperfection, chaos amidst order, and letting go. It's about knowing that however much control we think we may have, things can all fall apart or burst into something unexpectedly wonderful at any moment, even without our hands tightly on the reigns.

Please see fxtext article linked from main project page for more background on the project and rendering notes.

Some key commands in live mode:

G : Toggle grain
S : Save current resolution
1 : 4000x5000
2 : 6000x7500
3 : 8000x10000
4 : 10000x12500
5 : 12000x15000
6 : 14000x17500
(1-6 work best on Chrome)
(rendering takes longer as resolution increases)

metadata.name: MindFlow #22
metadata.description:
Consciousness flows over our mind, just like Karma goes through our body, which creates our life.

--------------------

This is an abstract generation made by pure code.

--------------------

In live mode, press 's' or 'S' to save a high resolution png (3000*4500).

Please be patient with drawing process and have fun with its tiny logo animation.
I hope you like this work and enjoy exploring your own mindflow.

Endlessworld 2022

metadata.name: R3B00T #31
metadata.description:
The variety of noises is infinite. If today, when we have perhaps a thousand different machines, we can distinguish a thousand different noises, 
tomorrow, as new machines multiply, we will be able to distinguish ten, twenty, or thirty thousand different noises, 
not merely in a simply imitative way, but to combine them according to our imagination.
- Luigi Russolo (The Art of Noises, 1916)

___

Generative visual, noise algorithm, organic pattern, inspired by compact disc format, transform in autonomous system, and made with code.

* Interactive feature :
- Place your mouse cursor to visual screen (canvas)
- Left click to spin the cd and play audio
- Right click to reset or back to original

* Every piece in this project have different unique audio. (All sounds created with modular synthesizer)

___

More info & updates :
twitter.com/FahmiMursyid
ideologikal.bandcamp.com
instagram.com/_fahmi_mursyid_

metadata.name: Klyft #375
metadata.description:
“Klyft” is part of the fxhash interactive minting experience at PARIS+ par Art Basel.

Klyft is a juxtaposition of two different projections for the future. One, made by the World Economic Forum, suggests that the global gender gap will have closed by the year 2154. The other, by the UN IPCC, estimates that global warming will reach 3.2 degrees celcius by the year 2100.

Klyft makes use of the unique temporal aspect of computational art by developing its expression gradually over the next 132 years. As we come closer to 2154, the space between the two shapes in Klyft will grow smaller to symbolize the closing of the gender gap. As time goes on, however, Klyft also becomes more and more glitched out to represent the projected increases in greenhouse gases and climate catastrophes.

In the end, Klyft’s expression will be heavily corrupted, and the two shapes will have reached each other.

· URL parameters ·

You can add the following parameters to the URL to change the behavior of the piece.

date=<YYYY-MM-DD> — See how Klyft looks on another day. Use the format YYYY-MM-DD. 

color=<number> — See the piece in another color scheme. The numbers loop around, so 17 equals 0, 18 equals 1, etc. 

resolution=<number> — View the piece in a higher resolution. 1 is normal resolution, 2 is double, etc. No decimals allowed.

image=true — Save the piece as an image. 

record=true — Save the piece as a video in WEBM format.

Adding the following URL parameters will show Klyft in double resolution on the day gender equality is achieved according to the WEF:

date=2154-01-01&resolution=2

Adding the following URL parameters will save a video of Klyft in the ‘Stokkendahl Dalgas’ color scheme:

color=14&record=true

· Interactions ·

Pressing the following keys will trigger functionality as well as add related URL parameters automatically. 

Pressing D will increment the date by 1 year.

Pressing C will increment the color index by 1.

Pressing R will toggle between normal and double resolution.

Pressing I will toggle the image URL parameter, which saves the piece as an image. Only works outside of iframe.

Pressing V will toggle the video URL parameter, which saves the piece as a video. Only works outside of iframe.

There are secret key presses as well. Some of them only work outside of iframe. 

· Accessibility ·

Klyft is built to support screen readers. It has been tested using MacOS’ VoiceOver, and uses p5.js’ describeElement() to provide screen reader functionality.

If you have any comments (good or bad) on the screen reader integration, don’t hesitate to reach out on my Twitter: @ada_ada_ada_art. 

· Credits and license ·

Klyft is made with p5.js.

Klyft is licensed under a modified version of the Climate Strike License (CSL).

metadata.name: Sketchbook Splash #487
metadata.description:
A splash of color on some scribbled shapes.

There are several keybindings to modify the image:
'1' - Toggles watercolors
'2' - Toggles overlaying constrast shapes 
'3' - Toggles sketch outlines
'4' - Toggles shape/splatter clipping (will fill the entire canvas with watercolor!)
'B' - Cycles borders; black, white, all colors in the palette being used, and no border

Play around to find something you like, and then press 'S' to download a copy of your image. 
You can also modify the URL parameters at the end of the URL to change the size of the image, such as &x=2560&y=1440. Keep in mind that this will result in a slightly different image, but colors/shapes/general layout will remain the same. The default size is 2048x2048.

@teaboswell, 2022
License: CC BY-NC-ND 4.0
For third party license information, please see bundle.js.LICENSE.txt
